com.xilinx.rapidwright.gui

Class TileView

  • Object
    • QGraphicsView
      • com.xilinx.rapidwright.gui.TileView
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlockView

    public class TileView
extends QGraphicsView
    This class is written specifically for the DeviceBrowser class and provides the Qt View. It controls much of the interaction from the user.

        public boolean hasPanned

    • Constructor Detail

      • TileView

        public TileView(QGraphicsScene scene)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        scene - The DeviceBrowser scene

    • Method Detail

      • mousePressEvent

        public void mousePressEvent(QMouseEvent event)
        This method is called when any mouse button is pressed. In this case, a right click will allow the user to pan the array of tiles.

      • mouseReleaseEvent

        public void mouseReleaseEvent(QMouseEvent event)
        This method is called when any mouse button is released. In this case, this will disallow the user to pan.

      • mouseMoveEvent

        public void mouseMoveEvent(QMouseEvent event)
        This method is called when the mouse moves in the window. This will reset the window based on the mouse panning.

      • wheelEvent

        public void wheelEvent(QWheelEvent event)
        This method is called when the mouse wheel or scroll is used. In this case, it allows the user to zoom in and out of the array of tiles.

      • keyPressEvent

        public void keyPressEvent(QKeyEvent event)
        This method gets called when a key on the keyboard is pressed. In this case, if the '=' key is pressed, it zooms in. If the '-' key is pressed, it zooms out.

      • zoomIn

        public void zoomIn()

      • zoomOut

        public void zoomOut()

      • addPBlockMode

        public void addPBlockMode(boolean b)
        Parameters:
        b -
